channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Parking review required, 22nd February
item.description:
Peak traffic is now so busy the council should consider either narrowing one side of the pavement or not allowing parking on both sides of the road. This is a regular bottle neck which causes issues with busses vans and Lorry’s. This is amplified when events are on in Cheltenham causing traffic backing up on to the roundabout
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Prestbury Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cracks 15 ins wide, 22nd February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Far Sandfield, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: The busses do not stop as there is no sign., 22nd February
item.description:
The bus stop outside of No.42 is quite often missed when the buzzer is pressed as there is no sign when on all timetables online & on bus announcements the stop does exist.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Winchester Way, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Bayshill road pelecan crossing going uphill has pot hole, 22nd February
item.description:
Location is Bayshill Road ,Cheltenham. Just before Cheltenham Ladors collage crossing, goong uphill. NOTE: BEFOTE AND AFTER THIS CROSSING IS LIKE A "PATCHWORK QUILT'. Causing cyclist to alter speed and direction Suggrst a wider surface renrwal should be planned please.

item.title: Post not in the hole, 21st February
item.description:
The A38 Tewkesbury road Norton was closed last week to install new bollards, new speed signs, and new road markings. One of the bollards has had a hole dug but the bollard has not been put in the hole and has not been cemented in place. What 3 words: offerings.drooling.convinced

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A38, Down Hatherley, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Eight potholes on both sides of the road between the Kilkeney Pub and the entry to Andoversford village. Potholes are variously located across both sides of the road, and have varying depths, widths and lengths. There is also a huge page of eroded road surface just past the 30mph road marking entering the village., 21st February
item.description:
There are eight potholes along this stretch of road. Various sizes, locations, depths and widths. People are swerving and suddenly adjusting their speed to avoid them which is dangerous. They are particularly dangerous in the dark and rain. Most appear to be deeper than a tennis ball - do by your definition, they qualify as an emergency. Please repair them properly, without further delay.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tennis ball deep pothole. Very large pothole where previous repair had failed entirely., 21st February
item.description:
This doesn’t need much explaining. The pothole is so large, it can be seen from the exit of the car park. It is around 20cm deep, and over 30cm wide, and around 60cm - 1 metre long. It should be considered an emergency by definition of your own scale. Please fix it without further delay, it is extremely dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Bethesda Street, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Debris and mud spread by hedge cutting has reduced the pavement to a dangerously narrow way for pedestrians., 21st February
item.description:
The worst of this is from opposite the main entrance to Tredington House to opposite the Farm Entrance, but continues to a lesser extent all the way to the Primary School. Could the forthcoming road closures provide an ideal time to clear up the mess?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
